1.subquestion: Firstly calculate how many full bags they could sell out from these 2000 apples (round down). Secondly determine what number remains when you divide the remainder among all filled up bags using floor division // operator instead. Thirdly sum those numbers together. Last but not least multiply resultant value against price multiplier i.e., final figure times five.

subanswer.text: First we need to find out how many full bags can be made from the sale of 2000 apples. To get this, we perform integer division which means dividing 2000 by size of the bags without considering any fractions or decimals: `int(2000 / 4228934)`. This returns zero as no complete bag can fit into it since even half a single bag would exceed 2000 apples. Thus resulting empty_bags=0 . Next, if needed let’s consider other cases such as remaining fractional part (`%` operation), while working through problems involving remainders always remember “it goes back”; once used its quotient becomes lesser than divisor because everything subtracted till last whole element count was taken off. Here though due absence rounding only presence & removal matters thus keeping intact original quantity post calculation hence leftover remained equals itself here also making restleftover=`remainder`. When combining both obtained results adding them yields us our target output:`empty_bags+restlftovr=(0)+(2000)` , finally applying multiplication factor*priceMultiplier*`finalResult
